content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

Given my preference for security and certainty, I would choose the option that guarantees the highest average payoff over the long term. In this case, choosing 'B' will earn me 20$ per round if my opponent also chooses 'B', which happens every other round (50 out of 75 rounds). Additionally, when my opponent chooses 'R', I still get a guaranteed 40$, while they only get 0$.

So, in total, I would earn approximately [(50*20) + (25*40)] = $1800. On the other hand, if I choose 'R' and my opponent chooses 'B', I would earn 0$ in those rounds, and since they always get paid something, I cannot guarantee their choice over the long term.

Therefore, I would choose B{B} as my strategy for this game.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

Now that I know my opponent chooses 'R', it does not affect my strategy since my goal is to maximize my long-term payoff. However, knowing my opponent's choice allows me to anticipate their future choices and adjust my own accordingly to optimize my overall earnings.

In the next round, I will still choose 'B'. This is because even though my opponent chose 'R', it doesn't guarantee that they will continue choosing 'R' for all 75 rounds. If my opponent switches their choice to 'B' in any future round when I am also choosing 'B', we both earn 20$. So, by consistently choosing 'B', I maximize the chances of earning those additional 20$ whenever my opponent switches their choice to 'B'.

Therefore, in this next round, I will still choose B{B}.

In the next round, I will choose 'R'{R}. This is because if my opponent continues choosing 'R', it means that they are only earning 0$ for each of those rounds. However, if they switch their choice to 'B' at some point in the future, I want to be able to earn the maximum possible payoff (45$) when we both pick 'R'. By choosing 'R' now, I am creating an opportunity for myself to do so in a potential future round where my opponent may switch their choice to 'B'.

In essence, by mixing my choices between 'B' and 'R', I can maximize the chances of earning 45$ when my opponent switches their choice to 'B' or earn 20$ when we both pick 'B' in any given round. So, for this next round, I will choose R{R}.
